io.netty.handler.codec.dns

Class DnsResponseHeader

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.netty.handler.codec.dns.DnsHeader
      • io.netty.handler.codec.dns.DnsResponseHeader

  • public final class DnsResponseHeader
extends DnsHeader
    The DNS response header class which is used when receiving data from a DNS server. Contains information contained in a DNS response header, such as recursion availability, and response codes.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class io.netty.handler.codec.dns.DnsHeader

        OPCODE_IQUERY, OPCODE_QUERY, TYPE_QUERY, TYPE_RESPONSE

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DnsResponseHeader(DnsMessage parent, int id)
      Constructor for a DNS packet response header.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isAuthoritativeAnswer()
      Returns true if responding server is authoritative for the domain name in the query message.
      boolean isRecursionAvailable()
      Returns true if DNS server can handle recursive queries.
      boolean isTruncated()
      Returns true if response has been truncated, usually if it is over 512 bytes.
      DnsResponseCode responseCode()
      Returns the 4 bit return code.
      DnsResponseHeader setAuthoritativeAnswer(boolean authoritativeAnswer)
      Set to true if responding server is authoritative for the domain name in the query message.
      DnsResponseHeader setId(int id)
      Sets the id for this DnsMessage.
      DnsResponseHeader setOpcode(int opcode)
      Sets the opcode for this DnsMessage.
      DnsResponseHeader setRecursionAvailable(boolean recursionAvailable)
      Set to true if DNS server can handle recursive queries.
      DnsHeader setRecursionDesired(boolean recursionDesired)
      Sets whether a name server is directed to pursue a query recursively or not.
      DnsResponseHeader setResponseCode(DnsResponseCode responseCode)
      Sets the response code for this message.
      DnsResponseHeader setTruncated(boolean truncated)
      Set to true if response has been truncated (usually happens for responses over 512 bytes).
      DnsResponseHeader setType(int type)
      Sets the DnsHeader type.
      DnsResponseHeader setZ(int z)
      Sets the field Z.
      int type()
      Returns the DnsMessage type.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DnsResponseHeader

        public DnsResponseHeader(DnsMessage parent,
                 int id)
        Constructor for a DNS packet response header. The id is received by reading a DnsQuery and is sent back to the client.
        Parameters:
        parent - the DnsMessage this header belongs to
        id - a 2 bit unsigned identification number received from client

    • Method Detail

        public boolean isAuthoritativeAnswer()
        Returns true if responding server is authoritative for the domain name in the query message.

        Returns true if response has been truncated, usually if it is over 512 bytes.

      • responseCode

        public DnsResponseCode responseCode()
        Returns the 4 bit return code.

        public int type()
        Returns the DnsMessage type. This will always return TYPE_RESPONSE.

        See Also:

      • setZ

        public DnsResponseHeader setZ(int z)
        Description copied from class: DnsHeader
        Sets the field Z. This field is reserved and should remain as 0 if the DNS server does not make usage of this field.
        Overrides:
        setZ in class DnsHeader
        Parameters:
